candidates.title: macOS: install GNU tar
candidates.body: CI runs on macOS have started to fail due to https://github.com/actions/cache/issues/403. Use GNU tar instead of BSD tar to work around that.

candidates.title: Bump rustc_lexer, cfg-if to 1.0 and add new license to check
Bump chalk to use latest git to get upstream fix
candidates.body: * Chalk very recently (like an hour ago) merged a fix that prevents rust analyzer from panicking.  This allows it to be usable again for code that hits those situations.  See #6134, #6145, Probably #6120

candidates.title: Bump smol_str from 0.1.16 to 0.1.17
candidates.body:
When I built `rust-analyzer` today, I noticed the following warnings.

```
warning: use of deprecated item 'syntax::SmolStr::new_inline_from_ascii': Use `new_inline` instead
   --> crates/mbe/src/syntax_bridge.rs:639:30       
    |                                                                  
639 | ...                   (SmolStr::new_inline_from_ascii(1, &[punct.char as u8]), punct.id)
    |                        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^       
    |                                                                  
    = note: `#[warn(deprecated)]` on by default
                                                                       
warning: 1 warning emitted                                             
```

So I thought it would be a nice small PR.

candidates.title: Support active parameters at the per-signature level
candidates.body: No functionality change. This also pulls in a few other protocol changes that we don't use and updates crates.

candidates.title: Update chalk to 0.27 and add support for extern opaque types.

repo.name: rust-analyzer
